answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some sample policies you might find useful.
This is a computer use policy from City of Airdrie in the UK.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/14869/Computer_Use_Policy_User_Agreement
This policy from City of Las Cruces, NM covers the use of electronic devices.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/14331/Electronic_Devices_Use_Policy
I have also included the technology use police from the City of Dublin, OH
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/14506/Technology_Use_Policy
You may also be interested in looking at two recent Knowledge Network Questions about the use of laptops and iPads in local government.
This one discusses employee purchasing options to avoid oversight confusion.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/question/21381
And this question prompted a discussion about how iPads have been useful tools for local leaders.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/kn/Question/20371/Use_of_iPads_by_Local_Government
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Sharon Ergler
text: The Borough of State College is considering a compensation package for out-going Council members and we want to know if any municipalities have adopted a policy and/or guidelines for the use of municipality-owned laptops and/or tablets, including a by back purchase at the end of the term of the Council member/Supervisor.  Another option being considerered is to issue a laptop or tablet to the elected official at the beginning of their term and allow them to keep them at the end of their term.
title: Policies or Guidelines on the use of municipality owned laptops, tablets, etc.
